description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3njl5","text":"This protocol is aimed at amplifying the cytochrome c oxidase subunit I (COI) mitochondrial gene in eukaryotes. The primers (forward: mlCOIintF, reverse: HCO2198) utilized in this protocol are based on the primers utilized in Leray et al. 2013 (forward) and Folmer et al. 1994 (reverse).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bdr4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frr01","text":"Primers used: Fluidigm CS1+mlCOIinfF, Fluidigm CS2+HCO2198","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8d7h","text":"Amplicons generated using this protocol can then be sequenced using the Illumina platform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efm75","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44r9f","text":"Primary PCR amplicon products are then sent to Michigan State University's (MSU) Research Technology Support Facility (RTSF) for indexing, pooling, and sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c17b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92sb0","text":"This work was supported by NASA grant NNX14AP62A ‘National Marine Sanctuaries as Sentinel Sites for a Demonstration Marine Biodiversity Observation Network (MBON)’ funded under the National Ocean Partnership Program (NOPP RFP NOAA-NOS-IOOS-2014-2003803 in partnership between NOAA, BOEM, and NASA), and the U.S. Integrated Ocean Observing System (IOOS) Program Office.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: National Marine Sanctuaries as Sentinel Sites for a Demonstration Marine Biodiversity Observation Network (MBON)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"309ba","text":"This protocol is aimed at amplifying the cytochrome c oxidase subunit I (COI) mitochondrial gene in eukaryotes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6v0j1","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b49d6","text":"This work was supported by NASA grant NNX14AP62A ‘National Marine Sanctuaries as Sentinel Sites for a Demonstration Marine Biodiversity Observation Network (MBON)’ funded under the National Ocean Partnership Program (NOPP RFP NOAA-NOS-IOOS-2014-2003803 in partnership between NOAA, BOEM, and NASA), and the U.S. Integrated Ocean Observing System (IOOS) Program Office.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h8k6","text":"This protocol is aimed at amplifying the cytochrome c oxidase subunit I (COI) mitochondrial gene in eukaryotes. The primers (forward: mlCOIintF, reverse: HCO2198) utilized in this protocol are based on the primers utilized in Leray et al. 2013 (forward) and Folmer et al. 1994 (reverse).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rjks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq0re","text":"PCR reactions for COI were run with Fluidigm two-step amplification protocol for each sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p76r","text":"This method is applied because of its ability to amplify the target region (COI) across many different groups of organisms, the target region’s ability to discriminate between different taxa, and the common research application of this primer set allowing the data to be compared to a reference database and other published environmental datasets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

QUANTITY Provide quantities necessary for one application of the standard operating procedure (e.g. number of filters). REMARK For example, some of the consumable may need to be sterilized, some commercial solution may need to be diluted or shielded from light during the operating procedure. {"blocks":[{"key":"cpa0s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vvlb","text":"Disinfect work surfaces with 10% bleach, followed by 70% ethanol.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f93qu","text":"RNase Away and pipets with RNase Away","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iuvj","text":"UV pipets, molecular grade water, and tube racks for 20 minutes prior to starting protocol.\n","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9khbt","text":"PCR reactions were run in single 75ul reactions for each sample using the 26bp primers (forward: mlCOIintF, reverse: HCO2198) utilized in this protocol are based on the primers utilized in Leray et al. 2013 (forward) and Folmer et al. 1994 (reverse) with Fluidigm adapters CS1 & CS2. All primers listed in the 5’ to 3’ direction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bg0qh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96g9q","text":" protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n41k","text":"These parameters use a normal ramp minutes","1"],["hold","4° C","infinity","1"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bpn4a","text":"After PCR amplification of the marker region, PCR products were run through an agarose gel to confirm the presence of target bands and absense of non-specific amplification across environmental samples as well as the absence of amplification in no-template controls (NTCs).
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4clrp","text":"PCR products were purified and size selected using the Agencourt AMPure XP bead system (Beckman Coulter, USA).
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71an5","text":"A second agarose gel was run to confirm primer removal and retention of target amplicons after purification.
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42cg5","text":"Purified products were then quantified using Quant-It Picogreen dsDNA Assay (Life Technologies) on an fmax Molecular Devices Fluorometer with SoftMaxPro v1.3.1
","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ctfa","text":"Leray M, Yang JY, Meyer CP, Mills SC, Agudelo N, Ranwez V, Boehm JT, Machida RJ. (2013) A new versatile primer set targeting a short fragment of the mitochondrial COI region for metabarcoding metazoan diversity: application for characterizing coral reef fish gut contents. Frontiers in zoology, 10(1),1-4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":305}],"data":{}},{"key":"dsaq4","text":"Folmer O, Black M, Hoeh W, Lutz R, Vrijenhoek R (1994) DNA primers for amplification of mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase subunit I from diverse metazoan invertebrates. Molecular Marine Biology and Biotechnology, 3, 294–299.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":225}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FC171ECA696211EFA4880A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://frontiersinzoology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1742-9994-10-34"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FC171ECA696211EFA4880A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.mbari.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/Folmer_94MMBB.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ul1o","text":"From here, the amplicon products will move onto the indexing PCR step, normalization, pooling, and sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0gfl","text":"Reaction Mixture: PCR reagents, volumes, initial and final concentrations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43nkt","text":"Total volume per reaction 75 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48t1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f62d5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2398q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Reagent","Volume","Initial Concentration","Final Concentration"],"colWidths":[100,100,"157","154"],"data":[["Amplitaq Gold Fast PCR mastermix (Applied Biosystems)","37.5 μl","2X","1X"],["Forward Primer (mlCOIintF)","3 μl","5 μM","0.2 μM"],["Reverse Primer (HCO2198)","3 μl","5 μM","0.2 μM"],["molecular-biology grade water","28.5 μl","",""],["Template DNA","3 μl","1 - 20 ng/μl","0.04 - 0.8 ng/μl"]],"guid":"26C44B85820C4278A23BA4163CE02784","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Amplitaq Gold Fast PCR mastermix (Applied Biosystems)","37.5 μl","2X","1X"],["Forward Primer (mlCOIintF)","3 μl","5 μM","0.2 μM"],["Reverse Primer (HCO2198)","3 μl","5 μM","0.2 μM"],["molecular-biology grade water","28.5 μl","",""],["Template DNA","3 μl","1 - 20 ng/μl","0.04 - 0.8 ng/μl"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
